title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.7-9 | 01-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananj Nishalakaya Chakshur Unmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Lord Shri Krishna then prepared for his departure.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam describing Krishna's preparation for departure from Hastinapura.

segments.key_quote: Krishna's position as the Supreme Personality of Godhead is eternally a fact.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that although Krishna was acting as a Kshatriya, the Brahmanas worshipped Him because they knew Him to be the Supreme Personality of Godhead, emphasizing Krishna's eternal position.

segments.key_quote: He does not lose his position even though he may assume a subordinate position.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's unchanging position as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, even when He assumes a subordinate role, like that of Arjuna's chariot driver.

segments.key_quote: Those who know Krishna properly, they always understand he is Eternal Lord, and he is eternally the controller, eternally the master, and he is eternally worshipped by everyone.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that the Brahmanas, led by Vyasadeva, knew Krishna's true nature and worshipped Him accordingly, and that Krishna reciprocated greetings to honor social order.

segments.key_quote: Society can be perfectly organised in that way.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the varnashrama dharma, explaining that Krishna created the four divisions of society based on qualities and work, and that the goal is ultimate liberation through performance of one's duty and worship of Vishnu.

segments.key_quote: As soon as he seated himself on the chariot to start for Dwaraka, Krishna has seated himself.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna observed social customs to set an example and then introduces the next verse where Uttara hurries towards Krishna in fear.

segments.key_quote: The Lord protects everyone, but one who depends completely upon him is especially looked after by the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Uttara's situation and emphasizes the complete dependence of the Pandavas on Krishna's protection, explaining that pure devotees are especially cared for by the Lord.

segments.key_quote: O Lord of Lords, Lord of the Universe, You are the greatest of mystics. Please protect me for there is no one else who can save me from the clutches of death in this world of duality.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Uttara's prayer for protection from death, emphasizing that only Krishna can save one in this world of duality, and concludes by stating that the reason for her fear will be explained in the next verse.
